name: Kumar Sangakkara
bio: Kumar Chokshanada Sangakkara (Sinhala: කුමාර් චොක්ශනාද සංගක්කාර; born 27 October 1977) is a Sri Lankan cricket commentator, former professional cricketer, businessman and the former president of Marylebone Cricket Club. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest batsmen and wicket-keeper in the history of the sport. He was officially rated in the top three current batsmen in the world in all three formats of the game at various stages of his international career.[1][2][3][4][5] Sangakkara scored 28,016 runs in international cricket across all formats in a career that spanned 15 years.[6] At retirement, he was the second-highest run-scorer in ODI cricket, next only to Sachin Tendulkar, and the sixth-highest run scorer in Test cricket.[7][8]
